value.string: {   "messages": [      {         "role": "user",         "content": "Find the closest match for each line item in List 1 from the below dataset in List 2: List 1: Invoice Line Item# Invoice Description 1 USB Cable for Cradle List 2: SAP Item# SAP PO Text 10 RFD40 Com Cradle 20 USB Cable for Cradle 30 USB Cable for Single Slot Cradle to PC communication Return the SAP Item# for each item in List 1"      }   ]}

In the prompt, after keyword 'START#', details of 2 Lists are provided, which are separated by delimiter combination '@#'. Each List contain 2 columns separated by delimiter combination '#%'.Rows in both above lists are separated by delimiter combination '#nl'. Please give exclusive mapping of each records from List 1 to one corresponding best match record in List 2 in the JSON format. The JSON mapping output should mention values of only 1st columns from both the lists. Same record cannot be mapped with multiple records.Output should display only the mapping results. START# List 1: Invoice Line Item #% Invoice Description #nl 1 #% USB Cable for Cradle #nl 2 #% Single slot Cradle @# List 2: SAP Item #% SAP PO Text 10 #% RFD40 Com Cradle #nl 20 #% USB Cable for Cradle #nl 30 #% USB Cable for Single Slot Cradle to PC communication.

value.expression: In the prompt, after keyword 'START#', details of 2 Lists are provided, which are separated by delimiter combination '@#'. List 1 contains 2 columns - 'PDFLine, PDFDescription', List 2 contains 2 columns - 'CSVLine, CSVDescription'. List columns are separated by delimiter combination '#%'. Rows in both the above lists are separated by delimiter combination '#nl'. For each value from column 'PDFDescription' of List 1, find best possible matching value in column 'CSVDescirption' from List 2 with as less creativity as possible, and based on that matching, give 1:1 mapping of only first columns of both the lists i.e. 'PDFLine : CSVLine', in the JSON format only. Same record from List 1 cannot be mapped with multiple records of List 2. Output should display only the requested 1:1 mapping, values from columns 'PDFDescription' & 'CSVDescription' are not to be displayed in output and no extra explanation is expected in the output. START# List 1: PDFLine #% PDFDescription #nl $sList1$ @# List 2: CSVLine #% CSVDescription #nl $sList2$.

List 1 contains $nList1RowCount.Number:toString$ rows and following 2 columns - 'PDFLine, PDFDescription', List 2 contains 2 columns - 'CSVLine, CSVDescription'. List columns are separated by delimiter combination '#%'. Rows in both the above lists are separated by delimiter combination '#nl'. For all the $nList1RowCount.Number:toString$ rows of List 1, take the value from column 'PDFDescription', find best possible matching value in column 'CSVDescirption' from List 2 with as less creativity as possible, and based on that matching, give 1:1 mapping of only first columns of both the lists i.e. 'PDFLine : CSVLine', in the JSON format only. Same record from List 1 cannot be mapped with multiple records of List 2. Output should display only the requested 1:1 mapping, values from columns 'PDFDescription' & 'CSVDescription' are not to be displayed in output and no extra explanation is expected in the output.
